p: Conversely, ICU patients that could be managed with non-invasive ventilation were, respectively, 62% [ 52], 56% [ 51], 42% [ 50], 19% [ 49] and 11% [ 48]. As regards NIV, data on Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) patients suggest a high failure rate [ 53]. Moreover, NIV carries the risk of widespread diffusion of exhaled air and airborne viral transmission, although recent reports show that newer systems with good interface fitting might reduce this risk [ 54, 55]. It is recommended that patients receiving a trial of NIV remain in a monitored setting, with the possibility of rapid ETI in case of acute deterioration or lack of improvement [ 7].
